definition[0]: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc
example[0]: The child was quivering in her arms.
example[1]: Her mouth quivered slightly as she turned away.
example[2]: I lay there quivering with fear.
example[3]: His voice was quivering with rage.
example[4]: I felt a quiver of excitement run through me.
definition[2]: a long case for carrying arrows
